alert.note: Alert for Alexander (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:27PM EST until January 11 at 1:11AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and dam gate releases is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Alexander, Catawba and Iredell. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Unusual, damaging flooding is developing with considerable impacts to property. Floodwaters reaching depths of 4-6 feet may be impacting yards, docks, and lake-access areas. Flooding less than 1 ft deep may begin for first-floor building elevations. Some homes and businesses may be stranded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 PM EST, Rainfall accumulations of 3-5 inches on Tuesday over the headwaters of the Catawba River, Johns River, and associated tributaries has caused high flows and rising lake pool elevations along the upper Catawba River. This has caused Lookout Shoals Lake to exceed full pool. Lookout Shoals is expected to exceed the Moderate Flood Stage of 104.0 feet. Between 103 and 104 feet, significant inundation of low-lying areas including residential yards, docks, and boat-launch areas is ongoing around Lookout Shoals Lake. Lake floodwaters may be approaching the crawl space of 4867 Longfield St. At 104 feet, lake floodwaters are approaching some homes in the Carpenters Cove community and electricity shutoff is imminent. Residents along Longfield St and in the Carpenters Cove community should have completed the protection of property adjacent to the lake and be prepared to follow guidance from Catawba County Emergency Management. - The latest pool elevations for the upper Catawba River lakes are as follows (Full Pool is 100.0 feet): Lake James: 97.14 feet and rising steadily. Lake Rhodhiss: 99.03 feet and rising rapidly. Lake Hickory: 97.81 feet and rising rapidly. Lookout Shoals Lake: 100.81 feet and rising rapidly. Forecast: Lookout Shoals Lake is projected by Duke Energy to reach or exceed 104.0 feet Tuesday night as water is moved through the Catawba River reservoir system. No additional rainfall will occur until Friday. However, it will take some time for Catawba River high flows to move through the reservoir system. For the latest information on lake levels, reservoir projections, and dam releases from Duke Energy, please visit: http://lakes.duke-energy.com or call 1-800-829-5253. Residents along Lookout Shoals Lake should contact Catawba County Emergency Management to update their contact information by visiting the Community Alert System web page at: www.catawbacountync.gov/online-services/community-alert- system/ - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Riverbend Park, Lookout Shoals Lake, and Buck Point Rd. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Residents are encouraged to heed guidance from local officials and Catawba County Emergency Management on any potential impacts to property. Drivers are encouraged to heed any barricades and avoid all flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
